caption.text: “Broad” groupings of zooplankton taxa from the CPR used in this study. Total abundance (equal to the total count of all organisms) was also used as a broad-scale indicator of zooplankton type.

cell.text: Oithona similis

Cyclopoid copepods, dominated by
Oithona similis
(97% of all, including unidentified Cyclopoida which are likely to be
O. similis
), unidentified (3%).

All other copepods, including calanoid, other cyclopoid, and harpacticoid copepods. This group aggregates more than 90 CPR groups and includes more than 50 separate species, and also includes unidentified and unidentifiable (damaged) copepods (64% of total). Of identified specimens the most abundant were:
Calanus simillimus
(29%),
Ctenocalanus citer
(27%),
Clausocalanus
spp. (18%),
Rhincalanus gigas
(11%),
Neocalanus
spp. (4.8%),
Calanoides acutus
(3.2%),
Metridia
spp. (2.7%), others <1% (including
Oncaea
spp., 0.5%).

All Hyperiidae, and includes unidentified specimens (46%). Of those identified:
Themisto gaudichaudii
(83%),
Phronima
spp. (10%),
Vibilia
spp. (2.6%),
Hyperiella
spp. (2.2%),
Hyperia spinigera
(1.0%), others <1%.

All Sagittidae, 68% not identified further. Of those identified:
Eukrohnia hamata
(75%),
Pseudosagitta
spp. (25%).

All adult and developmental stages of krill (generally not identified to species or genus). Also includes unidentified and unidentifiable (damaged) euphausiids (29% of total). Of identified specimens the most abundant were:
Thysanoessa macrura
(64%),
E. superba
(9.0%),
Thysanoessa gregaria
(6.6%),
E. vallentini
(5.8%),
E. frigida
(5.5%),
Nyctiphanes australis
(4.7%),
E. triacantha
(1.6%), others <1%.
Majority of Foraminifera specimens (97.8%) were unidentified further.

Fritillaria
spp.
Solitary, free-swimming larvacean, unidentified beyond genus.

Oikopleura
spp.
Larvacean, unidentified beyond genus.
Unidentified beyond class.

Pelagic gastropods, all but 0.1% identified to genus:
Limacina
spp. (98.9%),
Clio
spp. (1.0%).

Includes remaining organisms that are rarely identified including cephalopods, fish, fish eggs, isopods, “jellies” (salps, ctenophores, siphonophores), mysids, polychaetes, protozoa and shrimps. In total, these comprise <1% of total CPR samples.

statement.text: There are eleven groups of zooplankton taxa.
Every group has different description.
Group Oithona similis has less unidentified percent.
Group Ostracoda is unidentified beyond class.
There are twelve groups of zooplankton taxa.
Every group has same description.
Larva is present in the group Ostracoda.
In addition to the 11 broad-scale taxonomic groupings, total zooplankton abundance across all taxa was also calculated.

caption.text:
Performance of the
combined
BRT models, and dependencies on sampling and environmental variables for each univariate model. Values shown are the proportions of variance explained by each of the variables (%).
E
coszen
represents the time of day of sampling in terms of the cosine of the solar zenith angle. Environmental variables include all components (i.e. month, climatological month, climatological year average and annual anomaly). The mixed layer depth variable (
mld
) includes both
mld0p030
and
mld0p125
variables.

coszen
Total abundance

Fritillaria
spp.
Oithona similis

statement.text: The highest sst value is 20.09 of Oithona similis.
The highest value is 0.1 of Sealce in Euphausiidae cluster.

The other variables in decreasing order of overall importance were mixed layer depth, time of day ( E coszen ), primary production ( vgpm ), phytoplankton biomass ( chl ), month , sstgrad (indicative of frontal activity), and sea-ice concentration ( seaIce ).

caption.text:
Types of Boosted Regression Tree models used in this study. The environmental layers used are given in
.
CU
= cumulative (long-term average);
anMean
= annual mean (mean of monthly data between April of the previous year and March of the present year inclusive);
MC
= monthly climatology (e.g. average January);
MO
= monthly resolution;
MAnom
= monthly anomaly (equal to MO minus MC). ‘E
coszen
’ is the cosine of the solar zenith angle and gives an indication of day-night to allow for diel variation in zooplankton. ‘
Month
’ is the month of year. ‘Training’ refers to the process of fitting the model to data. ‘Extrapolation’ means applying the model to make predictions.

statement.text: There are five different types Model name.
The Description for clim Model name is Training: Monthly climatological oceanographic conditions. Extrapolation: Actual monthly means used instead of climatological months.
Actual measurements of conditions for the sampling month is Description for climAnom Model name.

caption.text: Environmental data used in analysis (see for examples).

cell.text:
mg m
−3

Near surface concentration of chlorophyll-a estimated from the default (case 1) processing of MODIS-Aqua (version R2018.0) and SeaWiFS (version R2018.0) satellite sensors, blended using overlap period 2002-2010. The data set spans the period September 1997 to August 2018.

;
NASA (2018a, b)
°C

Sea Surface Temperature (SST). The dataset used is the Optimum Interpolation Sea Surface Temperature (OISST), version 2, based on satellite measurements by the Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer series, operated by NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration of the USA) The data set spans the period 1981 to August 2018.

°C km
−1
Spatial gradient of SST obtained from a 20 pixel (180 km) smoothed version of OISST, extended beyond the analysis domain to avoid edge effects.
NIWA unpublished

Sea ice concentration data set derived using measurements from the Scanning Multichannel Microwave Radiometer (SMMR), the Special Sensor Microwave/Imager (SSM/I) sensors and Special Sensor Microwave Imager/Sounder (SSMIS). The data set has been generated using the Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometer - Earth Observing System (AMSR-E) Bootstrap Algorithm with daily varying tie-points.

, updated 2007;
https://nsidc.org/

mgC m
−2
d
−1

Net primary production, integrated over the whole water column (mgC/m
2
/d) from the Vertically Generalized Production Model (VGPM). Based on
www.science.oregonstate.edu/
ocean.productivity/

mld0p030
mld0p125

Two mixed-layer depths (using a 0.030 kg m
−3
and 0.125 kg m
−3
potential density difference criteria) were used as they potentially capture different characteristics of the water column structure.
Mixed layer depth were from GLBu0.08 hindcast: (1)
hycom
: from day 265 (2008) to present; (2)
fnmoc
: from day 169 (2005) to present; (3)
soda
: from day 249 (1997) to end of 2004; (4)
tops
: from day 001 (2005) to 225 (2010).

statement.text: There are 6 types of variables.
Each variable has its own unit.
the description given for each variable is uniquely defined.
The unit of SeaIce is m.
Reference for sst and vgpm is same.
All the variables has same unit.
